alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lonoke; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lonoke, northwestern Jefferson and southeastern Pulaski Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over England, or 18 miles south of Lonoke, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... England... Keo... Hensley Island... Allport... Coy... Sherrill... Tucker... Gethsemane... Wright... Tomberlin... Tar Camp Park... Seaton... Blakemore... Ferda... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and southeastern Arkansas.
